title: [Progress in the treatment of ovarian cancer].
summary: Of all gynaecological tumours, ovarian cancer has the highest mortality rate because it is often not diagnosed until the tumour is at an advanced stage due to the lack of early symptoms and suitable screening tests. ...
abstract: Of all gynaecological tumours, ovarian cancer has the highest mortality rate because it is often not diagnosed until the tumour is at an advanced stage due to the lack of early symptoms and suitable screening tests. The aim of this paper is to examine the current state of diagnosis and therapy.
